block.p: Katie Mauro, the daughter of Melanie and Frank W. Mauro Jr. of Stockton, Calif., was married yesterday in Stanford, Calif., to Abraham Ives Zeigler, a son of Alison and Joseph Zeigler of Montclair, N.J. The Rev. Maurice Charles, an Episcopal minister and an associate dean for religious life at Stanford University, officiated at the Stanford Memorial Church. The Rev. Kenneth A. Gorsuch, a minister of the Reformed Church in America, took part in the ceremony.

The couple work in San Francisco, where the bride is an account supervisor at Porter Novelli, a public relations firm, and the bridegroom is a project manager at Charles Schwab & Company, the discount securities brokerage firm.

Katie Mauro, the daughter of Melanie and Frank W. Mauro Jr. of Stockton, Calif., was married yesterday in Stanford, Calif., to Abraham Ives Zeigler, a son of Alison and Joseph Zeigler of Montclair, N.J. The Rev. Maurice Charles, an Episcopal minister and an associate dean for religious life at Stanford University, officiated at the Stanford Memorial Church. The Rev. Kenneth A. Gorsuch, a minister of the Reformed Church in America, took part in the ceremony.

The couple work in San Francisco, where the bride is an account supervisor at Porter Novelli, a public relations firm, and the bridegroom is a project manager at Charles Schwab & Company, the discount securities brokerage firm.

Mrs. Zeigler, 26, graduated and received a master's degree in English literature from Stanford. Her father owns the Stockton Wheel Service, which manufactures and repairs wheels for automobiles and agricultural equipment. Her mother teaches kindergarten at Hazeltown Elementary School in Stockton.

Mr. Zeigler, 29, is known as Bram. He graduated magna cum laude from Dickinson College and received a master's degree in economics from Washington University in St. Louis. His mother is a bookkeeper in Montclair, where his father is a consultant to arts organizations on planning and fund-raising.
